pyslam.image_processing.feature_descriptors.extractors.end2end.orb_detect_and_compute#

Module Contents#

Classes#

ORB_Detect_And_Compute

An end-to-end ORB extractor that uses
class pyslam.image_processing.feature_descriptors.extractors.end2end.orb_detect_and_compute.ORB_Detect_And_Compute(numPoints: int)#

Bases: pyslam.image_processing.feature_descriptors.extractors.DescriptorExtractor.DescriptorExtractor[pyslam.image_processing.feature_descriptors.descriptors.ORB.ORB], pyslam.image_processing.feature_descriptors.extractors.KeypointExtractor.KeypointExtractor

An end-to-end ORB extractor that uses opencv’s orb.detectAndCompute internally.

Parameters:

numPoints – The number of keypoints to try and find and describe. No guarantee this number will actually be computed however.

__compute(inImg: PIL.Image.Image) → None#

An internal function that computes and saves keypoints and their corresponding descriptors. Since this is an end-to-end extractor these are done together, but since the API treats these as separate steps, simply return them separately.

getKeypoints(inImg: PIL.Image.Image) → List[pyslam.image_processing.feature_descriptors.Keypoint.Keypoint]#

Computes keypoints for the given image.

Parameters:

inImg – The image to compute Keypoints for.

Returns:

Returns a list of Keypoints.

getDescriptors(inImg: PIL.Image.Image, inKeypoints: List[pyslam.image_processing.feature_descriptors.Keypoint.Keypoint]) → List[pyslam.image_processing.feature_descriptors.descriptors.ORB.ORB]#

Returns all descriptors we computed internally.

Parameters:

  • inImg – The image to compute Descriptors for.

  • inKeypoints – The list of Keypoints to compute descriptors for.

Returns:

Returns a list of Descriptors. We expect it to have the same size as inKeypoints, with the Nth descriptor describing the Nth keypoint.
